intro: Duroia gransabanensis, commonly known as the Gran Sabana arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the tepuis of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its large, arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in the humid, nutrient-poor soils of the Andean highlands. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. Duroia gransabanensis is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its high-altitude habitat.
